comments.body:
One new feature in conda-build are run exports. See the docs here: https://conda.io/docs/user-guide/tasks/build-packages/define-metadata.html#export-runtime-requirements. 

This might simplify maintenance of these tools. You could add a run export to `ldas-tools-ldasgen` and then anytime it is in the host requirements, it will always get added to the run requirements.
I personally think its better to have things be more explicit rather than less, but whatever's the 'standard', I'm happy to adhere to.

I agree in general and since you are doing maintenance you should have the final say. For things like low level libraries and compilers, this makes a lot of sense. Downstream, I get not wanting to use it. Happy to punt!
